question: Which designation would refer to the AWS US West (Oregon) region?
Which is an AWS Region for which customer access is restricted?
When you request a new virtual machine instance in EC2, your instance will automatically launch into the currently selected value of which of?
Which of the following are not globally based AWS services? (TWO AWS services)
Which would be a valid endpoint your developers could use to access a particular Relational Database Service instance you’re running in the Northern Virginia region?
note: The correct syntax for an endpoint is <service-designation>.<region-designation>.amazonaws.com

question: What are the most significant architectural benefits of the way AWS designed its regions? (TWO architectural benefits)

answers.answer: It can make applications available to end users with lower latency
It can make applications more compliant with local regulations

question: Why is it that most AWS resources are tied to a single region?
answer: Because those resources are run on a physical device, and that device must live somewhere

question: You want to improve the resilience of your EC2 web server. Which is the most effective and efficient approach?
answer: Launch parallel, load-balanced instances in multiple Availability Zones within a single AWS Region

question: Which is the most accurate description of an AWS Availability Zone?
answer: One or more independently powered data centers running a wide range of hardware host types

question: Which most accurately describes a subnet within the AWS ecosystem?
answer: The block of IP addresses assigned for use within a single Availability Zone

question: What determines the order by which subnets/AZ options are displayed in EC2 configuration dialogs?
answer: They (appear) to be displayed in random order

question: What is the primary goal of autoscaling?
answer: To ensure that a predefined service level is maintained regardless of external demand or instance failures

question: Which design strategie is most effective for maintaining the reliability of a cloud application?
Which of the following AWS services are not likely to benefit from Amazon edge locations? (TWO AWS services)
Which is the primary benefit of using CloudFront distributions?
answer: Reduced latency access to your content no matter where your end users live

question: What is the main purpose of Amazon Route 53?
answer: Managing domain name registration and traffic routing

question: According to the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, which are responsibilities of AWS?

answers.answer: Patching underlying virtualization software running in AWS data centers

question: According to the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, what’s the best way to define the status of the software driving an AWS managed service?
answer: Whatever the customer can control (application code and/or configuration settings) is the customer’s responsibility

question: Which is one of the first places you should look when troubleshooting a failing application?
